TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Notice My Bug Report, Senpai" Edition

Articles.Content: Break out the forensics unit!

Rowsdower has a picture of a plane on attack run.

"Attack run" is such a strong word. The plane is about to spread peace and harmony with pyrotechnic rocket demonstrations.

We should call it the Rowsdower Picture, like the Zapruder Film.

Lol love it. If in 10 years any of us are still rolling around here, I want to be able to say ' Where were you when you first saw the Rowsdower image (if we may Red)?' And I hope to hear a shout out.

Great devnotes!

The people with access to 0.25 now must be having a good laugh at us.

Dunno about everyone else, but I can neither confirm nor deny the presence of laughs on my end.

Lol love it. If in 10 years any of us are still rolling around here, I want to be able to say ' Where were you when you first saw the Rowsdower image (if we may Red)?' And I hope to hear a shout out.

Great devnotes!

Image is much better.

"Careful pixel by pixel analysis of the Rowsdower Image revealed: asymmetric control surface, working bomb bays, and three possible new features in the Kerbal Space Center. Squad tried to keep the Rowsdower Image hush-hush, but once it was accidentally linked in the Tuesday Devnotes there was no getting the cat back into the bag."

Dunno about everyone else, but I can neither confirm nor deny the presence of laughs on my end.

What? What are you implying, sir?

Hahaha KSC swimming pool... For training the Kebals I guess (Like NASA)?

"Yes, we paid a huge amount of Roots for this pool to train the Kerbonauts. Yes, it is entirely necessary for our board meetings to take place on lilos while holding cocktails. No, no banana hammocks are allowed."

Why does the ground look so smooth in that picture? Maybe it has something to do with deformable terrain? It's highly unlikely, because it could just be the terrain detail setting lowered a bit, but you never know...

Ok guys, I did some more detective work! Regarding the blob by the runway, next to the SPH. Keep in mind these are just what I think it looks like.

Firstly, I noticed the flag looking thing on top. Some thought it was the tail adapter, but the black square at the top makes it seem like a flag.

You may have to click the image, and zoom in further.

Secondly, I noticed the blob looked like a small square building.

Again, you may have to click the image and zoom in. (sorry if my lines kinda screwed up the picture)

What do you guys think? valid speculation?

It's half the height of the tower, I don't think it's a plane. I guess it could be a really big one. I parked my biggest plane there which uses the B9 HL series and it doesn't even sit 1/4 the way up that tower. At this angle it actually would look bigger than the angle of the "Rowsdower image"

Edited September 11, 2014 by Alshain

It's an oil derrick, resources are back in.

It's totally not that.

Let's call in the Kerbal Forensics!

How much do you want to bet that the next Devnote Tuesdays is going to have another image that is just that much closer?

Sooo....

Like it says, zoom in and step across the room, to try and defocus the whole image. (This is a super-close up, sharpened 4 or 5 times.)

ERMEGERSH!

Looky at this post!!!

weather station?

That was from the .25 Discussion Thread.

Could it be?!?
That "flag" could be a water tower like the one near the launchpad.

That "flag" could be a water tower like the one near the launchpad.

It seems pretty clear that there's only one "pole" coming down from the Square at the top.

Put this on your monitor and step waaaay back

THAT is hilarious!

What has happened to us. Who are we man??

Edited September 11, 2014 by Aethon

THAT is hilarious!

What has happened to us. Who are we man??

Just give in to the Hype. Maybe, just maybe, the Train will be departing sooner than expected...

(But seriously, we're trying to determine what something in a horribly blurred image is. What has happened to us?)
I'm still stuck on a small building with a flag. (see last page)

Hey mate, I stepped on the cat backin' away from my computer.

Edit- Wouldn't surprise me if we were being deliberately deceived. Put a lil' somethin' somethin' there, waaaaay off in the distance and staaaart the speculatin'.

Dev's need a hearty belly laugh at us ninnies once and a while.

Edited September 11, 2014 by Aethon

It seems pretty clear that there's only one "pole" coming down from the Square at the top.

I see two, one lit by the sun the other cast in shadow. If you compare it to the flag pole behind the admin building, it seems wider.

Edited September 11, 2014 by Alshain
I was able to enhance the Rowsdower Image a bit more, cleaned it right up.

I was able to enhance the Rowsdower Image a bit more, cleaned it right up.

She always has to be the center of attention.

Confirmed!

The secret feature for .25 is an extinct plesiosaur that lives in a pool or a pond next to the admin building. (...pond'd be nice for you.)

She always has to be the center of attention.

Indeed she did.

Here's a pixelated verion of the thingy. I'm reposting it here from the discussion thread. Whatever that turns out to be, it will forever be called NESSY.

Rofl, this community... ..sometimes...

*shakes head at ridiculousness*
